Text:
..."First, u need to goto Start, then run. Type in regedit in the box. Next, 
goto the folder HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\VxD\MSTCP 
Now, find the string DefaultRcvWindow. Now, edit the number to 64240
then restart your computer. There you go. High speed cable modem now 
with out dloading a program. Original value is 373360 "....

Ok... and how does this work, what does this do....?

This is hopelessly outdated.  HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\VxD?  That key doesn't even exist on PCs more recent than Windows 98/ME... if you're running 2k/XP it's worthless, they don't even have VxDs.  And second, changing the TCP window size is not going to have a very big impact on performance.  Somebody just put together a collection of semi-random changes to network settings for really old OSs... it's mostly harmless, but won't benefit you any.

Now, find the string DefaultRcvWindow. Now, edit the number to 64240
then restart your computer. There you go. High speed cable modem now 
with out dloading a program. Original value is 373360 "....

Ok... and how does this work, what does this do....? 



Thanks csquid... I thought so as well.... This why I did ask, maybe there ws someting I did not know.
i'm sorry guys i didnt know this was out dated but i did it my self a couple of years ago and it dobbled my connection speed
